jobs at Microsoft, with new blood coming in to run the key business units- prompted by Microsoft's misreading of some of the biggest technology trends of recent times, most notably smartphones and tablets. Over the past year we've seen the departure of many of the Microsoft old guard- including chief software architect Ray Ozzie and server and tools chief Bob Muglia- in preparation for the reshuffle. Steve Ballmer has been spearheading this effort and we don't see any change in his commitment to the company he's led for the past 11 years, he added.
